Which employees have never logged in?
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e LEFT JOIN employee_login l ON e.emp_no = l.emp_no WHERE l.emp_no IS NULL;

question: List usernames of employees who logged in today.
sql_query: SELECT username FROM employee_login WHERE DATE(last_login) = CURRENT_DATE;

question: How many employees have login access?
Which departments have employees with no login?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no LEFT JOIN employee_login l ON de.emp_no = l.emp_no WHERE l.emp_no IS NULL;

question: List employees who have been promoted (more than one title).
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

question: What are the usernames of employees who were hired in 2023?
sql_query: SELECT l.username FROM employee e JOIN employee_login l ON e.emp_no = l.emp_no WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM e.hire_date) = 2023;

question: Which managers have login credentials?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT l.username FROM employee_login l JOIN dept_manager dm ON l.emp_no = dm.emp_no;

question: Find employees who have access to more than one department.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM manager_department_access GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(dept_no) > 1;

question: Which employee last logged in most recently?
sql_query: SELECT username FROM employee_login ORDER BY last_login DESC LIMIT 1;

question: List all department names and the number of employees with access granted.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name, COUNT(m.emp_no) FROM department d JOIN manager_department_access m ON d.dept_no = m.dept_no GROUP BY d.dept_name;

question: Show departments accessed by employee 1005.
sql_query: SELECT dept_no FROM manager_department_access WHERE emp_no = 1005;

question: Which departments were accessed today?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT dept_no FROM manager_department_access WHERE access_granted_date = CURRENT_DATE;

question: How many departments have more than 5 employees?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT dept_no FROM dept_emp GROUP BY dept_no HAVING COUNT(emp_no) > 5) AS sub;

question: Get login details of employees who haven’t logged in in last 30 days.
sql_query: SELECT username FROM employee_login WHERE last_login < CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days';

question: List employees with current titles and department access.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT t.emp_no FROM title t JOIN manager_department_access m ON t.emp_no = m.emp_no WHERE t.to_date >= CURRENT_DATE;

question: Show all employees who are both a manager and have login access.
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no JOIN employee_login l ON e.emp_no = l.emp_no;

question: List employees whose birthday is in June.
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE EXTRACT(MONTH FROM birth_date) = 6;

question: How many employees joined each year?
sql_query: SELECT EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) AS year, COUNT(*) FROM employee GROUP BY year ORDER BY year;

question: Find employees who joined the same day they got login access.
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN employee_login l ON e.emp_no = l.emp_no WHERE DATE(e.hire_date) = DATE(l.created_at);

question: List departments where all employees have login accounts.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no LEFT JOIN employee_login l ON de.emp_no = l.emp_no GROUP BY d.dept_name HAVING COUNT(de.emp_no) = COUNT(l.emp_no);

question: Show all managers who have never been granted department access.
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no WHERE e.emp_no NOT IN (SELECT emp_no FROM manager_department_access);

question: Which employees have worked in more than 2 departments?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT dept_no) > 2;

question: Find employees who are still working in departments (to_date is future).
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp WHERE to_date > CURRENT_DATE;

question: List employees with overlapping salary periods.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM salary s1 JOIN salary s2 ON s1.emp_no = s2.emp_no AND s1.from_date < s2.to_date AND s2.from_date < s1.to_date AND s1.from_date != s2.from_date;

question: Find departments with more than one manager over time.
sql_query: SELECT dept_no FROM dept_manager GROUP BY dept_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT emp_no) > 1;

question: How many logins were created in 2024?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employee_login WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM created_at) = 2024;

question: List employees who have no title record.
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e LEFT JOIN title t ON e.emp_no = t.emp_no WHERE t.emp_no IS NULL;

question: Which employees are working in both 'IT' and 'Finance' departments?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp WHERE dept_no IN (SELECT dept_no FROM department WHERE dept_name IN ('IT', 'Finance')) GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT dept_no) = 2;

question: List employees who had salary changed in 2023.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT emp_no FROM salary WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM from_date) = 2023;

question: Which departments were managed in 2022?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT dept_no FROM dept_manager WHERE from_date <= '2022-12-31' AND to_date >= '2022-01-01';

question: Show login usernames of employees who are currently in any department.
sql_query: SELECT l.username FROM employee_login l JOIN dept_emp d ON l.emp_no = d.emp_no WHERE d.to_date >= CURRENT_DATE;

question: Get number of employees with the same last name.
sql_query: SELECT last_name, COUNT(*) FROM employee GROUP BY last_name HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

question: List employees who were managers and also accessed department on same date.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT dm.emp_no FROM dept_manager dm JOIN manager_department_access mda ON dm.emp_no = mda.emp_no AND dm.from_date = mda.access_granted_date;

question: Which departments had salary updates for employees in 2023?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no JOIN salary s ON de.emp_no = s.emp_no WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM s.from_date) = 2023;

question: Find employees with most frequent title changes.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 5;

question: How many employees were added every quarter in 2022?
sql_query: SELECT EXTRACT(QUARTER FROM hire_date) AS quarter, COUNT(*) FROM employee WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) = 2022 GROUP BY quarter;

question: List departments where no one has login access.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no LEFT JOIN employee_login l ON de.emp_no = l.emp_no GROUP BY d.dept_name HAVING COUNT(l.emp_no) = 0;

question: Find average salary per department.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name, AVG(s.amount) FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no JOIN salary s ON de.emp_no = s.emp_no GROUP BY d.dept_name;

question: Which employees changed their department in 2022?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM from_date) = 2022;

question: List top 3 departments with longest-serving managers.
sql_query: SELECT dept_no FROM dept_manager ORDER BY (to_date - from_date) DESC LIMIT 3;

question: Who are the newest hires in each department?
sql_query: SELECT dept_no, emp_no FROM (SELECT dept_no, emp_no, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY dept_no ORDER BY hire_date DESC) AS rn FROM dept_emp JOIN employee USING (emp_no)) t WHERE rn = 1;

question: Find how many employees got more than one salary in a year.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM salary WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM from_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM to_date) GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

question: List all usernames and their associated employee's title.
sql_query: SELECT l.username, t.title FROM employee_login l JOIN title t ON l.emp_no = t.emp_no WHERE t.to_date >= CURRENT_DATE;

question: Who got promoted from 'Junior Engineer' to 'Senior Engineer'?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title WHERE title IN ('Junior Engineer', 'Senior Engineer') GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT title) = 2;

question: Which department has the youngest average age of employees?
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no JOIN employee e ON de.emp_no = e.emp_no GROUP BY d.dept_name ORDER BY AVG(AGE(e.birth_date)) ASC LIMIT 1;

question: List employees who joined as manager from day 1 of employment.
sql_query: SELECT e.emp_no FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no WHERE e.hire_date = dm.from_date;

question: Which employees never got promoted (held only one title)?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(*) = 1;

question: Show department managers who manage departments they don't have access to.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_manager WHERE (emp_no, dept_no) NOT IN (SELECT emp_no, dept_no FROM manager_department_access);

question: What is the full name of employee ID 1001?
sql_query: SELECT first_name || ' ' || last_name AS full_name FROM employee WHERE emp_no = 1001;

question: Who are the employees hired in 2020?
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) = 2020;

question: Show all female employees hired before 2015.
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE gender = 'F' AND hire_date < '2015-01-01';

question: List employees born after 1990.
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE birth_date > '1990-01-01';

question: Get names of employees with last name 'Singh'.
sql_query: SELECT first_name FROM employee WHERE last_name = 'Singh';

question: Find the gender distribution of employees.
sql_query: SELECT gender, COUNT(*) FROM employee GROUP BY gender;

question: Which employees were hired between 2010 and 2020?
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE hire_date BETWEEN '2010-01-01' AND '2020-12-31';

question: How many employees are there in total?
List employees sorted by hire date.
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name, hire_date FROM employee ORDER BY hire_date;

question: Find employees whose first name starts with 'A'.
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE first_name LIKE 'A%';

question: List all departments.
Which department has the most employees?
sql_query: SELECT dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no GROUP BY dept_name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Who are the managers of the IT department?
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no JOIN department d ON dm.dept_no = d.dept_no WHERE d.dept_name = 'IT';

question: What is the total number of managers?
Show departments without a manager.
sql_query: SELECT dept_name FROM department WHERE dept_no NOT IN (SELECT dept_no FROM dept_manager);

question: Which departments have exactly 3 employees?
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no GROUP BY d.dept_name HAVING COUNT(de.emp_no) = 3;

question: List all department names and their manager names.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name, e.first_name || ' ' || e.last_name AS manager_name FROM department d JOIN dept_manager dm ON d.dept_no = dm.dept_no JOIN employee e ON dm.emp_no = e.emp_no;

question: Find the department with the oldest manager.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_manager dm ON d.dept_no = dm.dept_no JOIN employee e ON dm.emp_no = e.emp_no ORDER BY birth_date ASC LIMIT 1;

question: Which managers manage more than one department?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_manager GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT dept_no) > 1;

question: List all employees who were ever department managers.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no;

question: Show the current salary of employee 1023.
sql_query: SELECT amount FROM salary WHERE emp_no = 1023 ORDER BY to_date DESC LIMIT 1;

question: List employees with salary above 1,00,000.
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN salary s ON e.emp_no = s.emp_no WHERE s.amount > 100000;

question: What is the average salary in the company?
Find the highest salary paid.
Who is the highest paid employee?
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN salary s ON e.emp_no = s.emp_no ORDER BY s.amount DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which department pays the lowest average salary?
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no JOIN salary s ON de.emp_no = s.emp_no GROUP BY d.dept_name ORDER BY AVG(s.amount) ASC LIMIT 1;

question: Show salary history of employee 1005.
sql_query: SELECT amount, from_date, to_date FROM salary WHERE emp_no = 1005;

question: What is the total salary expense of the HR department?
sql_query: SELECT SUM(s.amount) FROM salary s JOIN dept_emp de ON s.emp_no = de.emp_no JOIN department d ON de.dept_no = d.dept_no WHERE d.dept_name = 'HR';

question: Who got a salary increase in 2022?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT emp_no FROM salary WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM from_date) = 2022;

question: How many employees earn between 50k and 70k?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT emp_no) FROM salary WHERE amount BETWEEN 50000 AND 70000;

question: List all distinct job titles.
Who held the title 'Senior Engineer'?
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN title t ON e.emp_no = t.emp_no WHERE t.title = 'Senior Engineer';

question: Which employee had the most titles?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT title) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Show the title history of employee 1020.
sql_query: SELECT title, from_date, to_date FROM title WHERE emp_no = 1020;

question: Find titles that were held by more than 10 employees.
sql_query: SELECT title FROM title GROUP BY title HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT emp_no) > 10;

question: What was the most common title in 2015?
sql_query: SELECT title FROM title WHERE from_date <= '2015-12-31' AND to_date >= '2015-01-01' GROUP BY title ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: List all employees currently holding any title.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT emp_no FROM title WHERE to_date >= CURRENT_DATE;

question: Who held a title for more than 5 years?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title WHERE to_date - from_date > INTERVAL '5 years';

question: Which employees have changed departments?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT dept_no) > 1;

question: List employees who are also department managers.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no;

question: Which department has the highest average salary in the last 2 years?
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no JOIN salary s ON de.emp_no = s.emp_no WHERE s.from_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '2 years' GROUP BY d.dept_name ORDER BY AVG(s.amount) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which employee has worked in the most number of departments over time?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp GROUP BY emp_no ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT dept_no) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Find the top 5 employees who have received the most salary increases (multiple salary entries).
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM salary GROUP BY emp_no ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 5;

question: List departments where managers never had login access.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_manager dm ON d.dept_no = dm.dept_no LEFT JOIN employee_login l ON dm.emp_no = l.emp_no WHERE l.emp_no IS NULL;

question: Which employee titles lasted for more than 5 years?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no, title FROM title WHERE (to_date - from_date) > INTERVAL '5 years';

question: List all employees who switched departments more than once in a year.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM from_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM to_date) GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT dept_no) > 1;

question: Find departments with the highest number of active employees today.
sql_query: SELECT dept_no FROM dept_emp WHERE to_date >= CURRENT_DATE GROUP BY dept_no ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which employees were both a department manager and an employee in the same department?
sql_query: SELECT dm.emp_no FROM dept_manager dm JOIN dept_emp de ON dm.emp_no = de.emp_no AND dm.dept_no = de.dept_no;

question: How many employees were hired and received salary on the same date?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employee e JOIN salary s ON e.emp_no = s.emp_no WHERE e.hire_date = s.from_date;

question: List employees who held different job titles within the same year.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM from_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM to_date) GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT title) > 1;

question: Which employees never changed their title over time?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT title) = 1;

question: Find departments where all employees have at least two different titles.
sql_query: SELECT dept_no FROM dept_emp de JOIN title t ON de.emp_no = t.emp_no GROUP BY dept_no HAVING MIN((SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT title) FROM title WHERE emp_no = de.emp_no)) >= 2;

question: Which employee had the longest span of employment in a single department?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no, dept_no, MAX(to_date - from_date) as duration FROM dept_emp GROUP BY emp_no, dept_no ORDER BY duration DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Find usernames of employees who logged in more than once in the same day.
sql_query: SELECT username FROM employee_login WHERE DATE(last_login) = DATE(created_at);

question: List employees who were hired before they were born (check data errors).
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM employee WHERE hire_date < birth_date;

question: List departments with no current managers.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d LEFT JOIN dept_manager dm ON d.dept_no = dm.dept_no WHERE dm.to_date < CURRENT_DATE OR dm.to_date IS NULL;

question: Find the average number of departments each employee has worked in.
sql_query: SELECT AVG(dept_count) FROM (SELECT emp_no, COUNT(DISTINCT dept_no) AS dept_count FROM dept_emp GROUP BY emp_no) AS sub;

question: List departments where at least one employee never got a salary.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT de.dept_no FROM dept_emp de LEFT JOIN salary s ON de.emp_no = s.emp_no WHERE s.emp_no IS NULL;

question: Which employee worked as a manager the longest?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_manager ORDER BY (to_date - from_date) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: List employees who were hired and promoted on the same day.
sql_query: SELECT e.emp_no FROM employee e JOIN title t ON e.emp_no = t.emp_no WHERE e.hire_date = t.from_date;

question: Which employees changed departments and titles on the same day?
sql_query: SELECT de.emp_no FROM dept_emp de JOIN title t ON de.emp_no = t.emp_no WHERE de.from_date = t.from_date;

question: Show employees who had access granted on a holiday (assume weekends).
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM manager_department_access WHERE EXTRACT(DOW FROM access_granted_date) IN (0, 6);

question: List the number of managers per department for the last 3 years.
sql_query: SELECT dept_no, COUNT(DISTINCT emp_no) FROM dept_manager WHERE from_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '3 years' GROUP BY dept_no;

question: Which employee has received salary in the most number of months?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM salary GROUP BY emp_no ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT DATE_TRUNC('month', from_date)) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which employee had the largest salary increase between two consecutive records?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM (SELECT emp_no, amount - LAG(amount) OVER (PARTITION BY emp_no ORDER BY from_date) AS diff FROM salary) sub ORDER BY diff DESC LIMIT 1;

question: How many employees got promoted more than twice?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT title) > 2;

question: List the most recent department each employee worked in.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no, dept_no FROM (SELECT *, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY emp_no ORDER BY to_date DESC) AS rn FROM dept_emp) t WHERE rn = 1;

question: List departments with overlapping manager terms.
sql_query: SELECT dm1.dept_no FROM dept_manager dm1 JOIN dept_manager dm2 ON dm1.dept_no = dm2.dept_no AND dm1.emp_no != dm2.emp_no AND dm1.from_date < dm2.to_date AND dm2.from_date < dm1.to_date;

question: Find employees with at least one title and one salary overlapping in time.
sql_query: SELECT t.emp_no FROM title t JOIN salary s ON t.emp_no = s.emp_no WHERE t.from_date < s.to_date AND s.from_date < t.to_date;

question: Which employees accessed a department before officially joining it?
sql_query: SELECT m.emp_no FROM manager_department_access m JOIN dept_emp d ON m.emp_no = d.emp_no AND m.dept_no = d.dept_no WHERE m.access_granted_date < d.from_date;

question: Which employees held multiple titles on the same day?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no, from_date HAVING COUNT(title) > 1;

question: Show how many employees left the company (no active dept, no login, no salary).
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employee e LEFT JOIN dept_emp de ON e.emp_no = de.emp_no AND de.to_date >= CURRENT_DATE LEFT JOIN salary s ON e.emp_no = s.emp_no AND s.to_date >= CURRENT_DATE LEFT JOIN employee_login l ON e.emp_no = l.emp_no WHERE de.emp_no IS NULL AND s.emp_no IS NULL AND l.emp_no IS NULL;

question: Which departments had the same manager come back twice?
sql_query: SELECT dept_no FROM dept_manager GROUP BY dept_no, emp_no HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

question: List employees with current active title but no department.
sql_query: SELECT t.emp_no FROM title t LEFT JOIN dept_emp de ON t.emp_no = de.emp_no AND de.to_date >= CURRENT_DATE WHERE t.to_date >= CURRENT_DATE AND de.emp_no IS NULL;

question: Which employee has worked in the same department multiple times?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no, dept_no FROM dept_emp GROUP BY emp_no, dept_no HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

question: Find employees who were given access before their hire date.
sql_query: SELECT m.emp_no FROM manager_department_access m JOIN employee e ON m.emp_no = e.emp_no WHERE m.access_granted_date < e.hire_date;

question: List all active employees who have no title assigned currently.
sql_query: SELECT e.emp_no FROM employee e JOIN dept_emp de ON e.emp_no = de.emp_no WHERE de.to_date >= CURRENT_DATE AND e.emp_no NOT IN (SELECT emp_no FROM title WHERE to_date >= CURRENT_DATE);

question: Show employees who had login access before their hire date.
sql_query: SELECT e.emp_no FROM employee e JOIN employee_login l ON e.emp_no = l.emp_no WHERE l.created_at::date < e.hire_date;

question: Find departments with more access grants than employees.
sql_query: SELECT dept_no FROM manager_department_access GROUP BY dept_no HAVING COUNT(emp_no) > (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM dept_emp WHERE dept_no = manager_department_access.dept_no);

question: List employees who switched from non-manager to manager role.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT dm.emp_no FROM dept_manager dm WHERE dm.emp_no NOT IN (SELECT emp_no FROM dept_manager WHERE from_date < dm.from_date);

question: How many employees have never received any salary?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employee e LEFT JOIN salary s ON e.emp_no = s.emp_no WHERE s.emp_no IS NULL;

question: Find top 5 employees who changed titles most frequently.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 5;

question: Which departments had the same title used by multiple employees?
sql_query: Which departments had the same title used by multiple employees?
column3: Which departments had the same title used by multiple employees?

question: Which employees had overlapping title and salary periods with different departments?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT t.emp_no FROM title t JOIN salary s ON t.emp_no = s.emp_no JOIN dept_emp de ON t.emp_no = de.emp_no WHERE t.from_date < s.to_date AND s.from_date < t.to_date AND t.from_date < de.to_date AND de.from_date < t.to_date;

question: How many employees had a title change and department change on the same day?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT t.emp_no) FROM title t JOIN dept_emp d ON t.emp_no = d.emp_no WHERE t.from_date = d.from_date;

Which employees have never logged in?
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e LEFT JOIN employee_login l ON e.emp_no = l.emp_no WHERE l.emp_no IS NULL;

question: List usernames of employees who logged in today.
sql_query: SELECT username FROM employee_login WHERE DATE(last_login) = CURRENT_DATE;

question: How many employees have login access?
Which departments have employees with no login?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no LEFT JOIN employee_login l ON de.emp_no = l.emp_no WHERE l.emp_no IS NULL;

question: List employees who have been promoted (more than one title).
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

question: What are the usernames of employees who were hired in 2023?
sql_query: SELECT l.username FROM employee e JOIN employee_login l ON e.emp_no = l.emp_no WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM e.hire_date) = 2023;

question: Which managers have login credentials?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT l.username FROM employee_login l JOIN dept_manager dm ON l.emp_no = dm.emp_no;

question: Find employees who have access to more than one department.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM manager_department_access GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(dept_no) > 1;

question: Which employee last logged in most recently?
sql_query: SELECT username FROM employee_login ORDER BY last_login DESC LIMIT 1;

question: List all department names and the number of employees with access granted.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name, COUNT(m.emp_no) FROM department d JOIN manager_department_access m ON d.dept_no = m.dept_no GROUP BY d.dept_name;

question: Show departments accessed by employee 1005.
sql_query: SELECT dept_no FROM manager_department_access WHERE emp_no = 1005;

question: Which departments were accessed today?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT dept_no FROM manager_department_access WHERE access_granted_date = CURRENT_DATE;

question: How many departments have more than 5 employees?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT dept_no FROM dept_emp GROUP BY dept_no HAVING COUNT(emp_no) > 5) AS sub;

question: Get login details of employees who haven’t logged in in last 30 days.
sql_query: SELECT username FROM employee_login WHERE last_login < CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days';

question: List employees with current titles and department access.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT t.emp_no FROM title t JOIN manager_department_access m ON t.emp_no = m.emp_no WHERE t.to_date >= CURRENT_DATE;

question: Show all employees who are both a manager and have login access.
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no JOIN employee_login l ON e.emp_no = l.emp_no;

question: List employees whose birthday is in June.
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE EXTRACT(MONTH FROM birth_date) = 6;

question: How many employees joined each year?
sql_query: SELECT EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) AS year, COUNT(*) FROM employee GROUP BY year ORDER BY year;

question: Find employees who joined the same day they got login access.
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN employee_login l ON e.emp_no = l.emp_no WHERE DATE(e.hire_date) = DATE(l.created_at);

question: List departments where all employees have login accounts.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no LEFT JOIN employee_login l ON de.emp_no = l.emp_no GROUP BY d.dept_name HAVING COUNT(de.emp_no) = COUNT(l.emp_no);

question: Show all managers who have never been granted department access.
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no WHERE e.emp_no NOT IN (SELECT emp_no FROM manager_department_access);

question: Which employees have worked in more than 2 departments?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT dept_no) > 2;

question: Find employees who are still working in departments (to_date is future).
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp WHERE to_date > CURRENT_DATE;

question: List employees with overlapping salary periods.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM salary s1 JOIN salary s2 ON s1.emp_no = s2.emp_no AND s1.from_date < s2.to_date AND s2.from_date < s1.to_date AND s1.from_date != s2.from_date;

question: Find departments with more than one manager over time.
sql_query: SELECT dept_no FROM dept_manager GROUP BY dept_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT emp_no) > 1;

question: How many logins were created in 2024?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employee_login WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM created_at) = 2024;

question: List employees who have no title record.
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e LEFT JOIN title t ON e.emp_no = t.emp_no WHERE t.emp_no IS NULL;

question: Which employees are working in both 'IT' and 'Finance' departments?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp WHERE dept_no IN (SELECT dept_no FROM department WHERE dept_name IN ('IT', 'Finance')) GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT dept_no) = 2;

question: List employees who had salary changed in 2023.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT emp_no FROM salary WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM from_date) = 2023;

question: Which departments were managed in 2022?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT dept_no FROM dept_manager WHERE from_date <= '2022-12-31' AND to_date >= '2022-01-01';

question: Show login usernames of employees who are currently in any department.
sql_query: SELECT l.username FROM employee_login l JOIN dept_emp d ON l.emp_no = d.emp_no WHERE d.to_date >= CURRENT_DATE;

question: Get number of employees with the same last name.
sql_query: SELECT last_name, COUNT(*) FROM employee GROUP BY last_name HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

question: List employees who were managers and also accessed department on same date.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT dm.emp_no FROM dept_manager dm JOIN manager_department_access mda ON dm.emp_no = mda.emp_no AND dm.from_date = mda.access_granted_date;

question: Which departments had salary updates for employees in 2023?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no JOIN salary s ON de.emp_no = s.emp_no WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM s.from_date) = 2023;

question: Find employees with most frequent title changes.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 5;

question: How many employees were added every quarter in 2022?
sql_query: SELECT EXTRACT(QUARTER FROM hire_date) AS quarter, COUNT(*) FROM employee WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) = 2022 GROUP BY quarter;

question: List departments where no one has login access.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no LEFT JOIN employee_login l ON de.emp_no = l.emp_no GROUP BY d.dept_name HAVING COUNT(l.emp_no) = 0;

question: Find average salary per department.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name, AVG(s.amount) FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no JOIN salary s ON de.emp_no = s.emp_no GROUP BY d.dept_name;

question: Which employees changed their department in 2022?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM from_date) = 2022;

question: List top 3 departments with longest-serving managers.
sql_query: SELECT dept_no FROM dept_manager ORDER BY (to_date - from_date) DESC LIMIT 3;

question: Who are the newest hires in each department?
sql_query: SELECT dept_no, emp_no FROM (SELECT dept_no, emp_no, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY dept_no ORDER BY hire_date DESC) AS rn FROM dept_emp JOIN employee USING (emp_no)) t WHERE rn = 1;

question: Find how many employees got more than one salary in a year.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM salary WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM from_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM to_date) GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

question: List all usernames and their associated employee's title.
sql_query: SELECT l.username, t.title FROM employee_login l JOIN title t ON l.emp_no = t.emp_no WHERE t.to_date >= CURRENT_DATE;

question: Who got promoted from 'Junior Engineer' to 'Senior Engineer'?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title WHERE title IN ('Junior Engineer', 'Senior Engineer') GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT title) = 2;

question: Which department has the youngest average age of employees?
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no JOIN employee e ON de.emp_no = e.emp_no GROUP BY d.dept_name ORDER BY AVG(AGE(e.birth_date)) ASC LIMIT 1;

question: List employees who joined as manager from day 1 of employment.
sql_query: SELECT e.emp_no FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no WHERE e.hire_date = dm.from_date;

question: Which employees never got promoted (held only one title)?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(*) = 1;

question: Show department managers who manage departments they don't have access to.
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_manager WHERE (emp_no, dept_no) NOT IN (SELECT emp_no, dept_no FROM manager_department_access);

question: What is the full name of employee ID 1001?
sql_query: SELECT first_name || ' ' || last_name AS full_name FROM employee WHERE emp_no = 1001;

question: Who are the employees hired in 2020?
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) = 2020;

question: Show all female employees hired before 2015.
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE gender = 'F' AND hire_date < '2015-01-01';

question: List employees born after 1990.
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE birth_date > '1990-01-01';

question: Get names of employees with last name 'Singh'.
sql_query: SELECT first_name FROM employee WHERE last_name = 'Singh';

question: Find the gender distribution of employees.
sql_query: SELECT gender, COUNT(*) FROM employee GROUP BY gender;

question: Which employees were hired between 2010 and 2020?
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE hire_date BETWEEN '2010-01-01' AND '2020-12-31';

question: How many employees are there in total?
List employees sorted by hire date.
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name, hire_date FROM employee ORDER BY hire_date;

question: Find employees whose first name starts with 'A'.
sql_query: SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employee WHERE first_name LIKE 'A%';

question: List all departments.
Which department has the most employees?
sql_query: SELECT dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no GROUP BY dept_name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Who are the managers of the IT department?
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no JOIN department d ON dm.dept_no = d.dept_no WHERE d.dept_name = 'IT';

question: What is the total number of managers?
Show departments without a manager.
sql_query: SELECT dept_name FROM department WHERE dept_no NOT IN (SELECT dept_no FROM dept_manager);

question: Which departments have exactly 3 employees?
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no GROUP BY d.dept_name HAVING COUNT(de.emp_no) = 3;

question: List all department names and their manager names.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name, e.first_name || ' ' || e.last_name AS manager_name FROM department d JOIN dept_manager dm ON d.dept_no = dm.dept_no JOIN employee e ON dm.emp_no = e.emp_no;

question: Find the department with the oldest manager.
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_manager dm ON d.dept_no = dm.dept_no JOIN employee e ON dm.emp_no = e.emp_no ORDER BY birth_date ASC LIMIT 1;

question: Which managers manage more than one department?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_manager GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT dept_no) > 1;

question: List all employees who were ever department managers.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no;

question: Show the current salary of employee 1023.
sql_query: SELECT amount FROM salary WHERE emp_no = 1023 ORDER BY to_date DESC LIMIT 1;

question: List employees with salary above 1,00,000.
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN salary s ON e.emp_no = s.emp_no WHERE s.amount > 100000;

question: What is the average salary in the company?
Find the highest salary paid.
Who is the highest paid employee?
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN salary s ON e.emp_no = s.emp_no ORDER BY s.amount DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which department pays the lowest average salary?
sql_query: SELECT d.dept_name FROM department d JOIN dept_emp de ON d.dept_no = de.dept_no JOIN salary s ON de.emp_no = s.emp_no GROUP BY d.dept_name ORDER BY AVG(s.amount) ASC LIMIT 1;

question: Show salary history of employee 1005.
sql_query: SELECT amount, from_date, to_date FROM salary WHERE emp_no = 1005;

question: What is the total salary expense of the HR department?
sql_query: SELECT SUM(s.amount) FROM salary s JOIN dept_emp de ON s.emp_no = de.emp_no JOIN department d ON de.dept_no = d.dept_no WHERE d.dept_name = 'HR';

question: Who got a salary increase in 2022?
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT emp_no FROM salary WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM from_date) = 2022;

question: How many employees earn between 50k and 70k?
sql_query: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT emp_no) FROM salary WHERE amount BETWEEN 50000 AND 70000;

question: List all distinct job titles.
Who held the title 'Senior Engineer'?
sql_query: SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN title t ON e.emp_no = t.emp_no WHERE t.title = 'Senior Engineer';

question: Which employee had the most titles?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title GROUP BY emp_no ORDER BY COUNT(DISTINCT title) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Show the title history of employee 1020.
sql_query: SELECT title, from_date, to_date FROM title WHERE emp_no = 1020;

question: Find titles that were held by more than 10 employees.
sql_query: SELECT title FROM title GROUP BY title HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT emp_no) > 10;

question: What was the most common title in 2015?
sql_query: SELECT title FROM title WHERE from_date <= '2015-12-31' AND to_date >= '2015-01-01' GROUP BY title ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: List all employees currently holding any title.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT emp_no FROM title WHERE to_date >= CURRENT_DATE;

question: Who held a title for more than 5 years?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM title WHERE to_date - from_date > INTERVAL '5 years';

question: Which employees have changed departments?
sql_query: SELECT emp_no FROM dept_emp GROUP BY emp_no HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT dept_no) > 1;

question: List employees who are also department managers.
sql_query: SELECT DISTINCT e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employee e JOIN dept_manager dm ON e.emp_no = dm.emp_no;
